intro: Gymnosporia austroyunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan gymnosporia, is a flowering plant species native to southwestern China. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub form. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and is known for its ability to thrive in rocky and arid environments. Its botanical features include simple leaves and small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
